fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.mimetype

Interface TikaBuilder<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling Parent.and() method)
    All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<MimeTypeProvider>, Parent<P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleTikaBuilder, TikaBuilderDelegate

    public interface TikaBuilder<P>
extends Parent<P>, Builder<MimeTypeProvider>
    Enable mimetype detection using Apache Tika.

    Tika is able to detect mimetype either based on file extension or based on stream content. Tika is enough smart to try several algorithms (extension, magic headers...).

    Even if several algorithms are used, Tika may not detect mimetype and in this case application/octet-stream mimetype is returned by Tika. The builder let you make detection fail if application/octet-stream is returned (see failIfOctetStream(boolean)). This is useful in order to try detection with another implementation.

    If no Tika instance is explicitly provided, default Tika instance is used (see Tika and TikaConfig.getDefaultConfig())

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      If Tika detection returns an application/octet-stream, it may means that detection was not enough accurate.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        TikaBuilder<P> instance(org.apache.tika.Tika tika)
        Provide custom Tika instance.

        This can be useful if the default instance doesn't fit your needs. This lets you complete control on Tika configuration.

        Parameters:
        tika - the Tika instance
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • failIfOctetStream

        TikaBuilder<P> failIfOctetStream(boolean fail)
        If Tika detection returns an application/octet-stream, it may means that detection was not enough accurate. In order to try other registered implementations that are able to detect mimetypes, you can set this to true.
        Parameters:
        fail - true to fail if mimetype returned by Tika is application/octet-stream, if false then application/octet-stream is used
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
